items.challengeText: Airworthiness Certificate, Registration, Radio Operators/Station License, Operating Limitation/Flight Manual, Weight & Balance (current)

items.responseText: PORT AND DRAIN CLEAR, TUBE WARM
NO LARGE DENTS, DEVIATIONS, OR OBSTRUCTIONS OBSERVED
NO LARGE DENTS, DEVIATIONS, OR OBSTRUCTIONS OBSERVED
INFLATED APPROPRIATELY, COTTER PIN IN PLACE
SEE WITNESS MARKS OR VERIFY THICKNESS
NO INDICATION OF LEAKS OR HOLES
NO LARGE DENTS, DEVIATIONS, OR OBSTRUCTIONS OBSERVED

SEE WITNESS MARKS OR VERIFY THICKNESS
NO INDICATION OF LEAKS OR HOLES

NO LARGE DENTS, DEVIATIONS, OR OBSTRUCTIONS OBSERVED
NO NICKS, DENTS, OR SEVERE SCRATCHES
GOOD TENSION AND IN GOOD CONDIOTION
3-4 FINGERS TALL AND IN GOOD CONDITION
INFLATED APPROPRIATELY, COTTER PIN IN PLACE
SEE WITNESS MARKS OR VERIFY THICKNESS

items.challengeText: L mag only if starter button, press button, then both after start
*Flooded start: start full lean and throttle full open then reverse when engine starts to fire
Wait at least 2 minutes after switching tanks before takeoff
All speeds listed here are in knots indicated airspeed (KIAS)
Fuel pump must be on to switch tanks
Choose efficiently considering surface, wind, and obstacles, then fly to it

items.responseText: TRY L & R (AND START IF PROP NOT WINDMILLING)

items.challengeText: Continue to next appropriate checklist if no restart
Unless engine starts, then run it at 1700 RPM for a few seconds

items.responseText: AVOID WATER; CONSIDER BEACH OR TREES

items.challengeText: If unable to avoid water: High winds/swells - land into wind. Light wind - land parallel to swells
Do not inflate until after exiting aircraft
After touchdown: evacuate aircraft; may need to open window first to equalize water pressure
Choose efficiently considering surface, wind, and obstacles, then fly to it
SECURE ENGINE WHEN LANDING ASSURED (IF OFF-AIRPORT)

items.responseText: ON WHEN ENGINE BEGINS LOSING POWER
LEAN IF USING CONTINUOUS CARB HEAT
NEAREST AIRPORT OR OFF-AIRPORT IF RAPID
APPROACH AT 70-80 OR MORE AS NEEDED
DO NOT USE (COULD CAUSE TAIL STALL)

items.challengeText: Or break VSI glass if inop/not installed

items.responseText: ASSUME READS SLOW, ADD SAFETY MARGIN
READS HIGH, ADD MARGIN TO APPROACH MINS
ZERO CROSSWIND OR FROM GOOD TIRE SIDE

items.challengeText: Hold weight off bad side as long as possible with ailerons
Hold weight off nose almost as long as possible with elevator
Gently lower nose onto runway and cushion impact with remaining back elevator before full nose up stop is encountered

items.responseText: PULL SLOWLY UNTIL RPM BEGINS TO REDUCE

items.challengeText: Experiment to become familiar with the narrow range where mixture controls RPM
COMPLETE A NORMAL APPROACH AND LANDING
Do not kill engine until landing is assured and all other options have been exhausted
Then slowly retract once positive rate of climb established
